alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 10:42AM MDT until June 15 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone at Edgar affecting Carbon County. Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone near Belfry affecting Carbon County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone...including Belfry, Edgar... Minor flooding is forecast. * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone at Edgar. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 10.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall tomorrow morning. It will rise to 11.5 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening to 6.3 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 06/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone Edgar 9.0 8.3 Sun 9 am 9.5 8.3 6.5 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1045 AM MDT.
